translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Paduma and Kesara
The Story of the Elder Phaladāyaka
“On the bank of the Bhāgīrathī River,
there was a hermitage at that time;
with fruit in my hand, looking on.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Phaladāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā phaladāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Phaladāyakattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā phaladāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽phaladāyaka therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: The Story of the Elder Phaladāyaka is the fifth.
